question: Gout, intellectual disability, self-mutilating behavior in a boy
Situs inversus, chronic ear infections, sinusitis, bronchiectasis, infertility
Blue sclera, multiple fractures, dental problems, conductive/mixed hearing loss
Elastic skin, joint hypermobility, bleeding tendency
answer: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome (type V collagen defect, type III collagen defect seen in vascular subtype)

question: Arachnodactyly, lens dislocation (upward and temporal), aortic dissection, hyperflexible joints
Arachnodactyly, pectus deformity, lens dislocation (downward and nasal)
Café-au-lait spots (unilateral), polyostotic fibrous dysplasia, precocious puberty, multiple endocrine abnormalities
Meconium ileus in neonate, recurrent pulmonary infections, nasal polyps, pancreatic insufficiency, infertility/subfertility, malabsorption/vitamin deficiencies
answer: Cystic fibrosis (CFTR gene defect, chromosome 7, ΔF508)

question: Calf pseudohypertrophy
answer: Muscular dystrophy (most commonly Duchenne, due to X-linked recessive frameshift mutation of dystrophin gene)

question: Child uses arms to stand up from squat
Slow, progressive muscle weakness in boys
answer: Becker muscular dystrophy (X-linked non-frameshift deletions in dystrophin; less severe than Duchenne)

question: Infant with cleft lip/palate, microcephaly or holoprosencephaly, polydactyly, cutis aplasia
Infant with microcephaly, rocker-bottom feet, clenched hands, structural heart defect
Single palmar crease, flat facies, prominent epicanthal folds, congenital heart disease, intellectual disability
Microcephaly, high-pitched cry, intellectual disability
answer: Cri-du-chat (cry of the cat) syndrome; congenital deletion on short arm of chromosome 5

question: Confusion, ophthalmoplegia/nystagmus, ataxia
answer: Wernicke encephalopathy (add confabulation/memory loss and personality changes for Korsakoff syndrome)

question: Dilated cardiomyopathy/high-output heart failure, edema, alcoholism or malnutrition
Megaloblastic anemia, subacute combined degeneration, paresthesias, cognitive changes
answer: Cobalamin (vitamin B12) deficiency; malabsorption, decreased intrinsic factor, absent terminal ileum

question: Swollen gums, mucosal bleeding, poor wound healing, petechiae, corkscrew hairs, perifollicular hemorrhages
answer: Scurvy (vitamin C deficiency: inability to hydroxylate proline/lysine for collagen synthesis); tea and toast diet

question: Bowlegs (children), bone pain, and muscle weakness
answer: Vitamin D deficiency: rickets (children), osteomalacia (adults); sun exposure, chronic kidney disease

question: Hemorrhagic disease of newborn with ↑aPTT, normal bleeding time
Intellectual disability, musty body odor, hypopigmented skin, eczema
Bluish-black connective tissue, ear cartilage, sclerae; severe arthralgias; urine turns black on prolonged exposure to air
Infant with hypoglycemia, hepatomegaly, cardiomyopathy
answer: Cori disease (debranching enzyme deficiency) or von Gierke disease (glucose-6-phosphatase deficiency, more severe)

question: Chronic exercise intolerance with myalgia, fatigue, painful cramps, myoglobinuria
answer: McArdle disease (skeletal muscle glycogen phosphorylase deficiency)

question: “Cherry-red spot” on macula
answer: Tay-Sachs (no hepatosplenomegaly); Niemann-Pick (with hepatosplenomegaly); or central retinal artery occlusion

question: Hepatosplenomegaly, pancytopenia, osteoporosis, avascular necrosis of femoral head, bone crises
Male child, recurrent infections, no mature B cells
Anaphylaxis following blood transfusion, atopy, airway/GI infections, autoimmune disease
Recurrent cold (noninflamed) abscesses, eczema, ↑serum IgE, eosinophils
answer: Hyper-IgE syndrome (Job syndrome: neutrophil chemotaxis abnormality; STAT3 mutation)

question: Late separation (> 30 days) of umbilical cord, no pus, recurrent skin and mucosal bacterial infections
answer: Leukocyte adhesion deficiency (type 1; defective LFA-1 [CD18] integrin)

question: Recurrent infections and granulomas with catalase ⊕ organisms
Fever, vomiting, diarrhea, desquamating rash after prolonged use of nasal pack or tampon
“Strawberry tongue”
answer: Scarlet fever (sandpaper rash); Kawasaki disease (lymphadenopathy, high fever for 5 days)

question: Colon cancer associated with infective endocarditis
Descending flaccid paralysis in newborn after honey ingestion
Abdominal pain, diarrhea, leukocytosis, recent antibiotic use
Grayish-white pseudomembranous pharyngitis with “bull’s neck” appearance
Acute adrenal insufficiency, fever, bilateral adrenal hemorrhage
Red “currant jelly” sputum in patients with alcohol overuse or diabetes
Fever, chills, headache, myalgia following antibiotic treatment for syphilis
answer: Jarisch-Herxheimer reaction (host response to sudden release of bacterial antigens)

question: Large rash with bull’s-eye appearance, flu-like symptoms
answer: Erythema migrans from Ixodes tick bite (Lyme disease: Borrelia bacteria)

question: Ulcerated genital lesion
answer: Nonpainful, indurated: chancre (1° syphilis, Treponema pallidum); Painful, with exudate: chancroid (Haemophilus ducreyi)

question: Smooth, moist, painless, wartlike white lesions on genitals
Pupil accommodates but doesn’t react to light
Dog or cat bite resulting in infection (cellulitis, osteomyelitis)
Atypical “walking pneumonia” with x-ray looking worse than the patient
Rash on palms and soles
answer: Coxsackie A infection, Rocky Mountain spotted fever, 2° syphilis

question: Black eschar on face of patient with diabetic ketoacidosis and/or neutropenia
Chorioretinitis, hydrocephalus, intracranial calcifications, ± blueberry muffin rash
Pruritus, serpiginous rash after walking barefoot, microcytic anemia
Febrile child later develops red facial rash with subsequent spread to body
answer: Erythema infectiosum/fifth disease (“slapped cheeks” appearance, caused by parvovirus B19)

question: Fever, cough, conjunctivitis, coryza, diffuse rash, Koplik spots
Systolic ejection murmur (crescendo-decrescendo), “pulsus parvus et tardus,” syncope, angina, dyspnea on exertion
Hyperdynamic pulses, wide pulse pressure, early diastolic murmur (decrescendo), head bobbing
Continuous “machinelike” murmur
answer: PDA (close with indomethacin; keep open with PGE1 and PGE2 analogs)

question: Chest pain on exertion
answer: Angina (stable: with moderate exertion; unstable: with minimal exertion or at rest)

question: Chest pain with ST depressions on ECG
Chest pain, pericardial effusion/friction rub, persistent fever following MI
answer: Postcardiac injury syndrome (autoimmune-mediated post-MI pericarditis, weeks to several months after acute episode)

question: Distant heart sounds, distended neck veins, hypotension
Painful, raised red/purple lesions on pads of fingers/toes
answer: Osler nodes (immune complex deposition in infective endocarditis)

question: Painless erythematous lesions on palms and soles
answer: Janeway lesions (septic emboli/microabscesses in infective endocarditis)

question: Telangiectasias, recurrent epistaxis, skin discoloration, arteriovenous malformations, GI bleeding, hematuria
Polyuria, polydipsia
answer: Primary polydipsia, diabetes mellitus (type 1 or 2), diabetes insipidus (central, nephrogenic)

question: Infant with vomiting, lethargy, jaundice, hepatomegaly after breastfeeding
Hypoglycemia, hepatomegaly, seizures, lactic acidosis in infant
Hyperextensible skin, joint hypermobility, bleeding tendency
Fair skin, light hair and eyes, intellectual disability, musty odor
Weak cry, hypotonia, tongue protrusion, umbilical hernia
Infant with abdominal distension, no meconium, family history of thyroid disease
Vomiting, polyhydramnios, gasless abdomen on x-ray in newborn
Downward lens dislocation, thrombosis, Marfanoid habitus
Hypoglycemia, hepatomegaly, hypotonia after fasting in infant
High fever, seizures, diffuse rash that starts on trunk then spreads
Recurrent otitis media, sinopulmonary infections, low IgG/IgA/IgE
Failure to thrive, recurrent infections, chronic diarrhea
Infant with cleft palate, micrognathia, wide-spaced eyes, absent thymic shadow
Persistent fever, splenomegaly, pancytopenia, intracellular amastigotes
Child with sore throat, sandpaper rash, strawberry tongue
Sudden cessation of inspiration during RUQ palpation
Increased creatinine after starting ACE inhibitor
Sudden flank pain, hematuria, no stones on imaging
answer: Renal papillary necrosis (e.g., sickle cell, NSAIDs, diabetes)

question: Hematuria, sensorineural hearing loss, lens abnormalities
Tea-colored urine, recent sore throat, facial edema
Child with hematuria, abdominal pain, palpable purpura
Hematuria, flank pain, abdominal mass in adult
Post-transplant fever, biopsy with dense lymphocyte infiltrate
Post-transplant hypertension, gradual loss of function, fibrosis on biopsy
Colonies of Pseudomonas in lungs, Cl⁻ on sweat test, immunoreactive trypsinogen
answer: Cystic fibrosis (CFTR gene mutation; fat-soluble vitamin deficiency)

question: ↑ β-hCG, ↓ PAPP-A on first trimester screening
↓ T cells, ↓ PTH, ↓ Ca²⁺, absent thymic shadow on CXR
Recurrent infections, eczema, thrombocytopenia, ↑ IgE and IgA, ↓/n IgG and IgM
Bacteria-covered vaginal epithelial cells, ⊕ whiff test
Ring-enhancing brain lesion on CT/MRI in AIDS
answer: Toxoplasma gondii (multiple), CNS lymphoma (may be solitary)

question: Dilated cardiomyopathy with apical atrophy, megacolon, megaesophagus
Narrowing of upper trachea and subglottis (Steeple sign) on x-ray
Cytoplasmic inclusions in Purkinje cells of cerebellum and in hippocampal neurons
Concentrically laminated calcified spherules (psammoma bodies)
answer: Papillary thyroid carcinoma, somatostatinoma, meningioma, mesothelioma, ovarian serous papillary cystadenocarcinoma, prolactinoma

question: Delta wave and shortened PR interval on ECG; may lead to supraventricular tachycardia
answer: Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome (bundle of Kent bypasses AV node)

question: Electrical alternans (alternating amplitude of R waves on ECG)
Granuloma with giant cells after pharyngeal infection
Empty-appearing nuclei with central clearing in thyroid cells
Hypertension, hypokalemia, metabolic alkalosis, ↑ aldosterone, ↓ renin
Narrowing of bowel lumen on small bowel follow-through
“Lead pipe” appearance of colon on imaging
Thousands of polyps on colonoscopy after puberty
“Apple core” lesion on barium enema x-ray
Fatty infiltration of hepatocytes, cellular “ballooning”, eventual necrosis
answer: Fatty liver disease (alcohol use or metabolic syndrome)

question: Antimitochondrial antibodies (AMAs)
answer: Primary biliary cholangitis (female, cholestasis, portal hypertension)

question: Hypochromic, microcytic anemia
answer: Iron deficiency, lead poisoning, thalassemia, sideroblastic anemia

question: “Hair on end” (crew cut) appearance on skull x-ray
“Starry sky” pattern with tingible body macrophages
Monoclonal spike on serum protein electrophoresis
“Soap bubble” lesion in femur/tibia on x-ray
“Codman triangle” or sunburst pattern on x-ray
Anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide and rheumatoid factor
↑ uric acid
answer: Gout, Lesch-Nyhan, tumor lysis syndrome, diuretics

question: ↑ AFP in maternal serum
answer: Dating error, open neural tube defects

question: Bloody or yellow CSF on lumbar puncture
Loss of dopaminergic neurons in substantia nigra
Extracellular amyloid in gray matter of brain
Small blue cells around central neuropil
Waxy casts with low urine flow
Linear IgG deposits on glomerular/alveolar BM
Effacement of podocyte foot processes on EM
answer: Minimal change disease, FSGS (more common in Black patients)

question: ↑ hCG
answer: Multifetal gestation, molar pregnancy, choriocarcinoma, dysgerminoma, Down syndrome

question: Call-Exner bodies (granulosa cells around eosinophilic fluid)
Reinke crystals (eosinophilic inclusions in Leydig cells)
Lines of Zahn (thrombus with alternating layers)
Golden-brown fusiform rods (dumbbell-shaped) in alveoli (Prussian blue stain)
Apical lung mass with Horner syndrome
Mitochondrial inheritance
answer: Occurs in all offspring of affected females; heteroplasmy

question: Vitamin deficiency (USA)
answer: Folate (especially in pregnancy; low body stores)

question: HLA-DR3
answer: Type 1 DM, SLE, Graves, Hashimoto thyroiditis, Addison

question: HLA-DR4
answer: Rheumatoid arthritis, type I DM, Addison disease

question: H. pylori
answer: Gastritis, peptic ulcers, gastric adenocarcinoma, MALToma

question: Healthcare-associated pneumonia
answer: S. aureus, Pseudomonas, other gram ⊕ rods

question: Bacterial meningitis (0–6 months)
answer: Group B Strep, E. coli, Listeria

question: S3 heart sound
answer: ↑ ventricular filling pressure (eg, MR, AR, HF, thyrotoxicosis); common in dilated ventricles

question: S4 heart sound
answer: Stiff/hypertrophic ventricle (eg, aortic stenosis, restrictive cardiomyopathy)

question: Cyanotic heart disease (early)
answer: Tetralogy of Fallot (most common), D-TGA, PTA, TAPVR, tricuspid atresia

question: Sites of atherosclerosis
answer: Abdominal aorta > coronary artery > popliteal > carotid > circle of Willis

question: Atrial fibrillation
answer: Irregularly irregular rhythm, ↑ risk of emboli

question: Cor pulmonale
answer: Right heart failure due to pulmonary cause

question: Infective endocarditis organism
answer: S. aureus (acute), viridans strep (subacute), gallolyticus (colon cancer), HACEK, Bartonella

question: Cushing syndrome
answer: Exogenous steroids, adenoma, Cushing disease, paraneoplastic ACTH

question: 1° hyperaldosteronism
answer: Bilateral adrenal hyperplasia or adenoma (Conn syndrome)

question: Ovarian metastases
answer: Krukenberg tumor (gastric origin, mucin-secreting signet cells)

question: Gynecomastia
answer: Cirrhosis, hypogonadism, testicular tumors, drugs (e.g., spironolactone)

question: Infection with dirty wound and spores
Infection with surgical instruments or trauma
Meningitis (neonates)
answer: Group B Strep, E. coli, Listeria

question: Neurodegenerative disorder
answer: Alzheimer disease (↓ ACh; amyloid plaques, neurofibrillary tangles)

question: Chorea
answer: Huntington disease (AD CAG repeat on chromosome 4)

question: Most common site of a berry aneurysm
Wilson disease
answer: ATP7B mutation → copper buildup in liver, brain, cornea

question: Hemochromatosis
answer: HFE mutation or transfusion overload → heart failure, bronze diabetes

question: Microcytic anemia
answer: Iron deficiency, thalassemia, lead poisoning, sideroblastic anemia

question: DIC triggers
answer: Sepsis, trauma, malignancy, obstetrics, heat stroke, pancreatitis

question: Most common non-Hodgkin lymphoma in adults
t(9;22)
answer: Philadelphia chromosome → CML (BCR-ABL), also seen in ALL
